conclusion: To determine the internal resistance of the silicon photocell, we need to analyze the given U-I graph.
Identify the Open-Circuit Voltage (U_oc): The open-circuit voltage is the voltage when no current flows through the circuit (i.e., I = 0).
From the graph, line a intersects the U-axis at U = 5 V.
Identify the Short-Circuit Current (I_sc): The short-circuit current is the current when the voltage across the circuit is zero (i.e., U = 0).
From the graph, line a intersects the I-axis at I = 0.4 A.
Determine the Internal Resistance (r): The internal resistance can be calculated using the formula r = U_oc / I_sc.
Substituting the values: r = 5 V / 0.4 A = 12.5 Ω.
Therefore, the internal resistance of the silicon photocell at this light intensity is 12.5 Ω.
